briefTitle: Safety of Indacaterol in Patients (≥ 12 Years) With Moderate to Severe Persistent Asthma
officialTitle: A 26-week Treatment, Randomized, Multicenter, Double-blind, Double-dummy, Parallel-group Study to Assess the Safety of Indacaterol (300 and 600 µg o.d.) in Patients With Moderate to Severe Persistent Asthma, Using Salmeterol (50 µg b.i.d.) as an Active Control
summary: This study was designed to assess the safety of indacaterol (300 µg and 600 µg (2 x 300 μg capsules) once daily \[od\]), compared with salmeterol (50 μg twice a day \[b.i.d.\]), over 26 weeks, in patients with moderate to severe persistent asthma.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With at Least 1 Adverse Event During the 26 Weeks of the Study
